para: ExpandNodeSelection selects nodes by selecting the neighbors of the currently selected &nodes;. The criterion parameter determines exactly which other &nodes; are considered to be neighbors. For illustrations, see the reference pages for the subclasses of .

Expanding the &node; selection is useful when applying &skel; modifier to a portion of a &skel;. For example, to improve the resolution of a boundary in a µ, it's convenient to the &nodes; that are close to the boundary. To do this, select the &nodes; on the boundary, expand the selection, and then the selected &nodes;.
